newsitem.title: SPAIN: SOCCER-BARCELONA GO TOP IN SPAIN AS CHAMPIONS ATLETICO CRASH.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-BARCELONA GO TOP IN SPAIN AS CHAMPIONS ATLETICO CRASH.

text.p: Barcelona bumped arch-rivals Real Madrid off the top spot in Spain thanks to a late goal by Luis Enrique Martinez in a hard-fought 1-0 win at Sevilla on Wednesday.
But the big news of a full first division programme was in the Vicente Calderon stadium where champions Atletico Madrid crashed 3-1 to lowly neighbours Rayo Vallecano.
Barcelona move two points ahead of Real, 2-1 winners at Zaragoza on Tuesday, while Atletico are a further 10 points back after just nine games.
Barcelona survived disallowed goals in each half but were kept afloat by keeper Vitor Baia and another Portuguese international, winger Luis Figo.
Just 12 minutes from time the game looked to be heading for a draw when Figo unleashed a fierce shot from outside the area which appeared to cross the line after bouncing off the bar.
Luis Enrique saved the referee the problem of consulting with his linesman by heading home the winner with Sevilla keeper Monchi Rodriguez stranded.
After the game Sevilla coach Jose Antonio Camacho accused the referee of "being scared" in calling offside on the disallowed goals.
Atletico Madrid's outspoken president Jesus Gil, who has blasted referees he believes favour Barcelona and Real Madrid over the past few days, was silenced by three goals by Rayo Vallecano.

Brazilian striker Guilherme, Croatian midfielder Stjepan Andrijasevic and Jesus Cota -- the first Spanish player to score for the side this season -- found the mark, before Juan Carlos Gomez snatched a late consolation goal for Atletico.

"We were a caricature of a team, there's a lot of things we have to do," grumbled Atletico coach Radomir Antic, whose side lost their way after Argentine striker Juan Eduardo Esnaider missed a penalty.

Third-placed Deportivo Coruna managed only a 1-1 draw at Racing Santander and fall two points behind Real Madrid while fourth-placed Real Betis are a further point back after returning home from Oviedo with the same score.

Valladolid are a surprise fifth after winning 1-0 at Logrones while Valencia helped veteran keeper Andoni Zubizarreta celebrate his 35th birthday with a 2-1 victory over Sporting Gijon that moves them up to sixth.
